CatDescriptText: James Jones, newsboy, Grove Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 28, 1961, pg. 21 with question: "Do you favor legislation or voluntary (appealing to the souls and conscience of men) methods, like arbitration, mediation, persuasion, etc., to obtain civil rights for minorities?"  Answer reads: "You should sit down and reason and then if you can't win, than you should pass a law."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of James Jones wearing plaid shirt and light colored coat with collar up, standing in front of store windows
